---
title: "Data Import"
output: github_document
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)

library(janitor)
```


Let's import the 'FAS_litters.csv' csv using a relative path

```{r}
litters_df =
  read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")

litters_df
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```

Import the same dataset using an absolute path

```{r}
litters_df =
  read_csv("/Users/karen/Desktop/P8105-DS-Building blocks/data_wrangling_i/data/FAS_litters.csv")

litters_df
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```

Import Pups dataset

```{r}
pups_df =
  read_csv("data/FAS_pups.csv")

pups_df =
  janitor::clean_names(pups_df)
```

## Look at data

```{r}
litters_df

head(litters_df)

tail(litters_df)
```

You can use view 

```{r, eval=FALSE}
view(litters_df)

```

Look at a data summaty

```{r}
str(litters_df)

skimr::skim(litters_df)
```
